item.title: Base Building Game With 'Very Positive' Reviews is Free to Play on Steam Until September 1
item.description:
Forts is a real-time strategy base-building game with 'Very Positive' user reviews on Steam , and it's currently free to play. The promotion is a great opportunity for fans of the genre to check out Forts , which has been refining its gameplay on Steam since 2017.

There are plenty of popular games on Steam that feature base building as a core mechanic, such as RimWorld , Subnautica , and Satisfactory . Most of these, however, focus heavily on survival as the driving philosophy behind constructing bases. Forts , by contrast, emphasizes real-time strategic and tactical combat.

Forts Is Free to Play on Steam Until September 1

Right now, a Free Weekend promotion on Steam lets fans play both the multiplayer and campaign of Forts at no cost. The promotion runs until September 1, giving players enough time to finish the campaign and enjoy plenty of multiplayer matches. Forts is normally priced at around $15 USD, so the free-to-play offer is a great chance to try it before committing. Even better, those who choose to buy it after the promo can get it at a 50% discount for a limited time.

The multiplayer aspect of Forts is one of its biggest draws. It features a 1v1 mode where two players face off in RTS combat to destroy each other's strongholds. There's also a mode that supports up to seven players in chaotic, action-packed matches, making it a fun party game to play with friends. The best part is that the current Free Weekend promo lets non-owners try all these modes for themselves, along with the Quick Battle, Skirmish, and Sandbox modes. In Sandbox mode, players can freely build unique bases and experiment with different features without facing opponents. It's a great way for newcomers to learn the mechanics and prepare for real battles.

Forts will soon release its third major DLC, Firebird, which will introduce a brand-new origin story. It will also add new maps, commanders, and weapons, further expanding the core base-building elements of the game. It's worth noting that Forts ' DLCs are usually paid additions, typically priced between $5 and $8 USD.

The free-to-play promotion for Forts isn't the only great deal for PC users right now. Until August 29, Steam users can claim Dead in Bermuda for free. Anyone who grabs this unique survival game before the deadline can keep it forever with no strings attached. August 28 also marks the last chance for Epic Games Store users to claim the current free-to-keep games, Strange Horticulture and Kamaeru , before they are removed from the platform.

item.title: Games That Looked Too Good To Be True (But They Were True!)
item.description:
It is a fairly common practice in the gaming industry to overpromise the features, innovations, and mechanics in an upcoming title in order to drive pre-order sales and secure a good start early on. Gamers burned by such practices are often skeptical when a new game reveal appears too good to be true, either when the graphics appear a tad too impressive, or when the scope and breadth of the game are being promoted to unrealistic levels.

Once in a blue moon, however, a game comes along that not only promises the world but delivers on it. Sometimes, these titles even understate how good they are, leaving players happily surprised when even their highest expectations for the game are blown out of the water. Here are some of the most notable games that appeared too good to be true before release, but ended up being exactly what the marketing portrayed them to be.

Elden Ring

FromSoftware’s Open-World Epic

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

The hype surrounding Elden Ring prior to the game’s release felt like a cosmic event. The fan theories, subplots, and deep dives that dissected every single frame from every tease and reveal were unlike anything anyone had ever seen before, except perhaps the highly anticipated Hollow Knight: Silksong .

An open-world twist on the FromSoftware formula with GRRM’s storytelling fueled the hype to unimaginable levels, so much so that Redditors were cautioning each other prior to release to manage expectations and to keep it realistic. Only for FromSoftware to blow expectations out of the water with the release, delivering a game that more than lived up to the hype.

Baldur's Gate 3

Dungeons and Dragons Brought to Life

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
141
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC, macOS
Powered by

Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s scope was legendary, and the idea of Larian Studios actually managing to deliver it anywhere close to what they were promising it would be in the pre-release marketing phase seemed impossible to a lot of people. The Act 1 demo did a lot to assuage those fears, but when Larian started promising things like 17,000 fully voiced endings, infinite replayability, and a CRPG experience the likes of which hadn’t even been imagined up to that point, people were skeptical to say the least.

With the full release of Baldur’s Gate 3 , however, all those promises came true in a way very few were ready for. BG3 sold over 10 million copies within a year of its release, and its D&D-inspired gameplay loop delivered with such polish that it even drew in players completely unfamiliar with the popular TTRPG. Larian swept the 2023 Game Awards, and deservedly so, cementing its legacy forever.

Black Myth: Wukong

An Action RPG Phenomenon

Black Myth: Wukong
6 /10
115
9.2 /10
Released
August 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
Powered by

Black Myth: Wukong ’s pre-launch trailers and early gameplay sneak peeks looked too good to be true for a lot of people. Unreal Engine 5, the game engine Black Myth: Wukong was developed in, has an unfortunate history of looking good in trailers but playing terribly, leading many to believe that this would be more of the same.

Upon release, however, Black Myth: Wukong proved naysayers wrong in spectacular fashion, delivering perhaps one of the best action RPG experiences of the entire year, in a complete, coherent package that put the entire Chinese gaming industry in the limelight.

World of Warcraft

The MMORPG That Defined the Genre

World of Warcraft
8 /10
30
9.2 /10
Released
November 23, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

It can be hard to remember now, but pre-launch hype surrounding World of Warcraft was something else. Taking the Warcraft universe and turning it into a living, breathing MMORPG seemed like an impossible task to many, and the breadth and scope of the project seemed too good to be true. Additionally, considering how graphically inferior MMOs were at the time, WoW ’s promises seemed nothing more than hot air.

However, it’s not a secret that since then, World of Warcraft has thrived in a way no other game has before or since. While it isn’t the longest-running live service game of all time, it’s definitely the most popular. WoW still enjoys a massive, incredibly loyal player base that isn’t going anywhere anytime soon.

Dune: Awakening

Funcom’s Best Survival Vision Yet

Dune: Awakening
22
9.1 /10
Released
June 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

The pre-launch marketing phase of Dune: Awakening was filled with grandiose promises that seemed too good to be true. Funcom’s shaky history with survival games and the seemingly massive scale of the title gave many fans pause in the lead-up to the final release, with many being of the opinion that the final product would be nowhere close to what was being advertised.

Upon release, however, it was evident that Dune: Awakening more than delivered. The massive desert world of Arrakis looked incredible, the survival mechanics hooked players, and there were more than enough building blocks to make some truly spectacular base structures, all the while staying true to established Dune lore. The endgame does have some issues, but the fact that Funcom managed to deliver a sufficiently complete product amidst the skepticism is still deserving of praise.

Palworld

Pokemon With Guns

Palworld
134
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

While the gameplay footage revealed in trailers and teasers looked impressive, Palworld was viewed as an inevitable failure by many prior to its release. Everyone was waiting for the other shoe to drop, counting down the days until Nintendo to sue “ Pokemon with guns” into oblivion. While Nintendo did end up filing a lawsuit against Pocket Pair for Palworld eventually, the game had already proved itself to players by then.

Palworld amassed over 2 million active players on Steam within the first few days of its release, selling over 25 million copies within its first month alone, making it one of the most successful indie games ever created.

Red Dead Redemption 2

A Benchmark in Open-World Design

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
169
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s gameplay trailers revealed before the game’s release showed a level of polish and attention to detail that was hard to fathom. The sheer realism and interactivity of the world were so absurdly ahead of its time that some were of the opinion that the game looked too good to be true.

But Red Dead Redemption 2 put all those doubts to rest with its release, offering players a game that felt so real it’s hard to believe it came out in 2018. Not only does it still hold up to this day, but RDR 2 overshadows many modern games, and by a massive margin at that.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance

A Historical RPG That Delivered

Kingdom Come: Deliverance
10
7.6 /10
Released
February 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch
Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance was viewed with quiet skepticism before release, with multiple factors contributing to the sentiment. For one, Warhorse Studios was an unknown entity at the time, with only a handful of developers promising a level of realism and complex gameplay that had only been achieved by the most ambitious AAA games in the past.

To top it off, KCD was being funded via Kickstarter, a platform with a history of scams disguised as game projects, taking money from unsuspecting backers without an intention of ever fulfilling their goals. Luckily, Kingdom Come: Deliverance , well, delivered, and in a big way. While the game wasn’t as massive a hit as some others on this list, it did eventually sell over 8 million copies, gaining a cult-like following in the process.

item.title: Best Stealth Build in Helldivers 2
item.description:
Helldivers 2 can be a very chaotic game, with all sorts of weapons and strategems that heavily inventive players to go out and obliterate the enemies of democracy without holding anything back. Despite this focus, there are a lot of mechanics in the game that focus on the enemies noticing the player.

While there is no focused stealth system in the game, players can make an entire build with the focus of not being detected, and try to sneak around and complete objectives without ever being seen. Here are the ins and outs of the stealth system, along with the best build to try and get the most out of it.

Best Stealth Build in Helldivers 2 (Feet First Armor Passive)

If you really want to try a stealth build, you'll need to get the ODST Warbond. Either armor set in this Warbond comes with the Feet First armor passive, which has your character make 50% less noise when moving . Noise will be the main thing your build should aim to counter, so you'll want to bring the two suppressed weapons in this Warbond as your primary and secondary:

  • M7S SMG
  • M6C/SOCOM Pistol

Best Stealth Strategems

Just about every strategem in the game will do something to give you away, but the following two strategems are very useful when you've been detected and need to break line of sight.

  • Eagle Smoke Strike
  • Orbital Smoke Strike

How Well Does Stealth Work in Helldivers 2

Overall, Stealth isn't your best approach, but that's not to say it doesn't work to some degree. With the Feet First passive, your movements will be very quiet, and always crouching or crawling will let you sneak right up behind an enemy . Line of sight will always be your biggest issue, but playing a nighttime mission and turning off your weapon's flashlight will greatly help you maintain obscurity.

Suppressed Weapons can still be heard by nearby enemies, but they have to be much closer than if you're firing a regular weapon . It's also important to note that if two enemies are close together, shooting one of them will alert the other, so save killing of any kind as a last resort unless an enemy is on their own.

The smoke strategems may not be a great damage-dealing option, but they are great for breaking the line of sight or also giving you cover to quickly take out a few enemies. While you can't see any better in the smoke, you'll move around quietly, and even if it's out in the open, enemies won't see or shoot you. Stealth may not be a go-to way to finish an operation, but it can be great for surprising your enemy by hitting a specific unit or structure.

item.title: What is the Easiest Faction to Fight in Helldivers 2?
item.description:
Helldivers 2 has three fronts in the galactic map for players to fight the enemies of democracy. Each faction comes with unique enemies, and players will need to adapt their build and playstyle to counter the enemy they are going up against.

No matter what you're fighting, the main goal of any operation is to win to help the battle for the planet and either claim it for Super Earth or keep it under that banner. Here is the easiest faction to fight that is ideal for winning against, along with the hardest faction that you should only go up against when you're ready.

Which Faction is the Weakest in Helldivers 2?

By far the weakest and easiest faction players can face is the Termanids . Focusing on the lower difficulties first, most of the Termanids only have light and only some have medium armor, making them ideal to kill with just about any weapon. Fire is also incredibly effective against them, and bringing any sort of fire weapons or strategems can literally melt away your enemies.

While Termanids focus on using numbers to their advantage, a lot of these bugs aren't much of a threat , even in large numbers. As you get to higher difficulties, the much stronger bugs can still be taken out with most strategems, and stronger weapons only make basic Termanids even easier to kill.

Bug Holes and Breaches are fairly easy to deal with, as a single high-explosive grenade can take care of the opening and anything that came out of it. The Termanid Front is by far the best place to start in Helldivers 2, letting you farm XP and get better gear before taking on the more difficult factions.

How Strong are the Illuminate in Helldivers 2?

The Illuminate are the middle-of-the-road faction, with their low difficulty levels being very easy, before getting very difficult in the higher difficulties . The Voteless rarely pose a threat even in high numbers, and as long as you take care of the stronger units with the right weapons first when they appear, the Voteless can be easily avoided.

As you increase the difficulty, Fleshmobs are only the start of the harder-to-kill enemies. The Illuminate use shields in a few ways that make it very difficult to take care of groups, as you need to lock onto a singular shielded target and focus them down until they are dead.

Which Faction is the Hardest to Fight in Helldivers 2

The Automatons are by far the most difficult to fight , even at the lower difficulty levels. This faction quickly has medium and even heavily armored units, with lots of very difficult to kill singular units. While you'll less fewer total Automatons in a fight, their smaller numbers aren't noticed as your screen quickly gets covered by blaster fire. Just about every unit in this faction has a gun with an impressive rate of fire and infinite ammo, and your playstyle will need to resemble that of a cover-based shooter game just to stay alive.

At the higher end, Automatons have actual tanks and massive walkers that can only be taken down with a handful of weapons, and their rates of fire and damage output can make short work of even an entire squad. The Automaton front is arguably the hardest one to hold, but players will want to get a few levels and get strong guns and strategems before trying to take on this enemy.

item.title: Best Open-World Games Great For Exploring On Foot
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games offer extensive exploration potential, but players often default to faster traversal methods.
  • Games like Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, Horizon Forbidden West, and Dragon's Dogma 2 shine with on-foot exploration richness.
  • Unique biomes, engaging storylines, and immersive environments make walking around in open worlds highly rewarding.

Open-world games are praised for their large maps that players can freely explore. Due to how large some of these open-world games are, developers commonly provide players with things such as mounts or fast travel points to allow them to quickly traverse the open world that is available to them. The only unfortunate fact of these mechanics is that some players may rely too heavily on them and therefore forget to explore the open world that has been provided.

Many of the best open-world games to be created have some of the most extraordinary exploration that a player can only truly experience if they remain on foot, walking around these glorious maps. Players who are looking for glorious open-world titles should look no further than these games that are better enjoyed by walking, ranked by how much these worlds provide players with things to explore.

Avatar: Frontiers Of Pandora

Explore The Land Of Pandora As A Na'Vi

Avatar: Frontiers Of Pandora
5 /10
10
7.3 /10
Released
December 7, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Language, Mild Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Massive Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Although Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora may have met its audience with mixed reviews, there is no denying that this title is perfect for those who not only enjoy exploring on foot but are also deeply in love with the Avatar franchise. While players are provided other means to navigate the wilderness of Pandora, keeping on their feet is still one of the best ways of exploring this interesting action-adventure game.

Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora has an incredibly large map to navigate, and while moving from one end to the next isn't great to do on foot, there are still plenty of reasons to try it. As a Na'vi, the player can traverse both the ground and trees with ease, making them truly feel like part of the people of Pandora. Not to mention plenty of other content, such as taking down the bases of humans to rid the land of pollution.

Assassin's Creed Valhalla

Plenty To Find In England During The Viking Age

Assassin's Creed Valhalla
9 /10
18
7.9 /10
Released
November 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
Stadia, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

In recent years, the Assassin's Creed franchise has leaned further into its open world settings to create historical countries for the player to traverse during a fascinating story. Out of all the recent titles, one of the best for not only its story but also its open-world was Assassin's Creed Valhalla . Set during the Viking Age of England, Valhalla had multiple areas of the country for Eivor – the protagonist – to visit and aid in the hopes of allowing their clan to keep their home.

Although boat navigation as well as mounts are available for players to help them traverse the rivers of England, although Eivor may not be a proper assassin, they still have the skills to navigate the world on foot as well as climb some extraordinary structures between 872 and 878 AD. When players aren't visiting real-life historical locations in Valhalla , they can instead admire the beauty of the place.

Horizon Forbidden West

Varied Biomes To Explore And Mechanical Beasts To Slay

Horizon Forbidden West
9 /10
37
8.6 /10
Released
February 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In the second game, Horizon Forbidden West , expands upon the world of the original as players explore an entirely new frontier that demands the help of Aloy if they hope to see Earth survive. Besides all the new mechanical beasts that can be found when playing Forbidden West, the main reason that this action RPG is one of the best for exploring on foot is all the new and diverse biomes that can be found here.

Aloy must visit different tribes in Horizon Forbidden West that all live in entirely different biomes, from some living in the hot deserts, while they can also be found on snow-covered mountaintops. Once again, players do have other ways of traversing Horizon Forbidden West , but to truly appreciate the environment and find various secrets that can help Aloy during her adventure.

Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

Embark On Another Epic Mission To Connect A Country

24 Images
24 Images
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
18
9.1 /10
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
Powered by

It wouldn't be right to not include the king of walking in an open world such as Death Stranding . In Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , players like the character Sam Bridges are given another mission to walk across the country to connect all the bunkers together.

Now in Australia, there are plenty of new things to discover that become even more fascinating when players attempt to navigate this world while remaining on foot. Although there may not be as much to explore in Death Stranding 2 , compared to other open-world games, due to its heavy focus on traveling across the land with cargo, heavy detail has been put into being able to walk from one location to another. Making these walks interesting is another reason why Death Stranding 2 is one of the best for this sort of on-foot exploration.

Dragon's Dogma 2

Limited Fast Travel Leads To Finding New Things

Dragon's Dogma 2
9 /10
17
7.0 /10
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Finally, a classic title returns as Dragon's Dogma 2 was a long-awaited action RPG game that has some intriguing features, which may take some players some time to get used to. While the majority of open-world titles tend to have fast travel points that players can freely use whenever they want to so that they can navigate the world quickly, Dragon's Dogma 2 doesn't exactly do this.

Instead, players can put down their own fast travel points and must spend certain things to then use them. This, therefore, encourages players to walk to their various objectives instead of relying on these, so they don't waste resources. While this can be hard to get used to, Dragon's Dogma 2 has plenty for players to find in the wild, such as side quests and caves they may have never seen otherwise.

Minecraft

A Sandbox Where No Two Worlds Are The Same

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
191
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Mojang
Platform(s)
3DS, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox 360
Powered by

The sandbox survival title Minecraft is more than just an open world to explore, as although the game has been updated countless times over the years to give players more options on how they can explore this world, walking from place to place is still one of the greatest feelings.

Even though Minecraft is a world made of cubes, there is so much to admire from the countless biomes that have been added, to digging underground to find their jackpot. If just being able to explore wasn't enough, the joy with this sandbox is that players can start the game all over again in an entirely new world that they can navigate on foot. Players are able to create their own goals in this title.

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Explore Hyrule Any Way The Player Likes

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
48
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Before The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , many of the Legend of Zelda titles were quite linear. However, in this one, players were given the freedom to truly explore however they saw fit. The final goal of reaching the castle can be achieved at any time, but for players to have the best chance of survival, they must first explore the far corners of Hyrule to gain the aid of others.

Players can tame horses in the wild for a quicker way to explore. However, since players in Breath of the Wild can climb and swim to various locations around the map, many players will likely find themselves leaving the horse at the stable anyway, so they can focus on finding resources, weaponry, and other ways to improve themselves.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

A Classic Open-World RPG With Plenty More To See

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Out of all the open-world games over the years, unsurprisingly, The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim continues to be a great game for those looking for a world they can enjoy by simply walking around. Skyrim already intrigues many players with its abundance of side stories that encourage the player to explore the various locations on the map.

In Skyrim , players can take wagons to quickly get to a different town or simply select places they have already visited on the map to go back there. Even though this is a feature players can use, many have challenged themselves to never use it and instead walk from one location to another. While on their journey, they are likely to encounter caves, crypts, and other ruins, which commonly have their own stories for the player to discover that aren't connected to any quests.
